---
title: "Side-by-side tables"
date: "2022-06-28"
categories: [tables]
---


## `layout-ncol`

Use the `layout-ncol` chunk option to organize output in columns, i.e., `layout-ncol: 2` for two table side-by-side.


::: {.cell layout-ncol="2"}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| layout-ncol: 2

library(knitr)

# table on the left
kable(head(mtcars[, 1:3]))

# table on the right
kable(head(cars))
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
|                  |  mpg| cyl| disp|
|:-----------------|----:|---:|----:|
|Mazda RX4         | 21.0|   6|  160|
|Mazda RX4 Wag     | 21.0|   6|  160|
|Datsun 710        | 22.8|   4|  108|
|Hornet 4 Drive    | 21.4|   6|  258|
|Hornet Sportabout | 18.7|   8|  360|
|Valiant           | 18.1|   6|  225|



| speed| dist|
|-----:|----:|
|     4|    2|
|     4|   10|
|     7|    4|
|     7|   22|
|     8|   16|
|     9|   10|
:::
:::
